alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 6:48PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A slow moving thunderstorm producing heavy rainfall will impact portions of northeastern Wake and southwestern Franklin Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 647 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Zebulon, or 11 miles east of Raleigh. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Heavy rain may lead to isolated flooding in poor drainage locations. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Wake Forest, Zebulon, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, Pilot and Falls Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
